title: Stacey Dooley throws beau Kevin Clifton a glitzy dinner party in celebration of his 37th birthday
text:
She went public with her romance earlier this year, just weeks after her split from her boyfriend of three years, Sam Tucknott.

And Stacey Dooley pulled out all the stops for her boyfriend Kevin Clifton as she threw him a lavish dinner party with his nearest and dearest to celebrate his 37th birthday on Saturday evening.

In cosy snaps shared to her Instagram account, the journalist, 32, appeared enamoured as she cosied up to the dancer in front of gold balloons which read 'King Kev'.

Doting girlfriend: Stacey Dooley pulled out all the stops for her boyfriend Kevin Clifton as she threw him a lavish dinner party to celebrate his 37th birthday on Saturday

The TV presenter - who won Strictly with the ballroom pro last year - has kept their relationship relatively private, but treated fans to a rare glimpse at their budding romance with the sweet images for the glitzy celebration.

Sharing adorable hugs with her man in the pictures, the auburn-haired beauty captioned her posts: 'Happy birthday King Kev' and '37 ❤️'.

The BBC star opted for retro glamour in a metallic PJ suit, while Grimsby native Kevin looked dapper in an all-black outfit.

Stacey and Kevin first embarked on a romance in April, and are said to have moved in with each other a month later.

In good company: The BBC star (pictured centre with her pals) opted for retro glamour in a metallic PJ suit, while Grimsby native Kevin looked dapper in an all-black outfit

The media personality settled into the dancer's flat after leaving the home she shared with her former partner in Brighton.

In the work department, Stacey is set to host the Strictly Come Dancing's 2020 arena tour.

The documentary maker won the prestigious Glitterball Trophy alongside her professional partner turned boyfriend Kevin in 2018 and will dust off her dancing shoes to front the 32-date event next year.

She's back! In the work department, media personality Stacey is set to host the Strictly Come Dancing's 2020 arena tour

Stacey will be joined on stage by a selection of celebrities and professional dancers from the much awaited 17th series of the award-winning BBC One show, with judging and casting announcements to be made over the coming months.

Despite winning the series last year, Kevin admitted he's finding it tough coming to terms with his early exit from Strictly.

The reigning champion off the BBC series was kicked out of the competition earlier this month after his Charleston with Anneka Rice failed to impress the judges or the voting public.
